info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 6:06PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EDDY...SOUTHERN LEA... NORTHWESTERN REEVES...NORTHWESTERN WINKLER...NORTHERN CULBERSON AND NORTHERN LOVING COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM CDT/700 PM MDT/... At 705 PM CDT/605 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 8 miles southwest of Malaga, or 16 miles south of Carlsbad, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Carlsbad, Artesia, Eunice, Jal, Hope, Pine Springs, Loving, Monument, McKittrick Canyon, Avalon, Eunice Airport, Seven Rivers Airport, Jal Airport, Nadine, Brantley Lake State Park, Red Bluff Reservoir, Orla, Carlsbad Caverns National Park, Malaga, and Carlsbad North. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
